qas.question: How much energy do geese conserve flying in a flock?
How much faster do Red knots and dunlins fly in a flock?
What does flying in flocks reduce?

context: Many, if not most, birds migrate <a0_0>in flocks<a0_0/>. For larger birds, flying in flocks reduces the <a4_0>energy cost<a4_0/>. Geese in <a3_0>a V-formation<a3_0/> may conserve <a1_0>12–20%<a1_0/> of the energy they would need to fly alone. Red knots Calidris canutus and dunlins Calidris alpina were found in radar studies to fly 5 km/h (<a2_0>3.1 mph<a2_0/>) faster in flocks than when they were flying alone.
